By the end of this course:

  • You’ll be able to set up, run, and analyze CFD models in FLOW-3D with confidence — ready to apply your skills to hydraulic structures, flow channels, spillways, and real-world engineering problems.

description:
Master GstarCAD: Complete CAD Software Training from Scratch

Discover the powerful alternative to AutoCAD that's transforming architectural design workflows worldwide. GstarCAD has emerged as a cost-effective, professional-grade CAD solution that offers full compatibility with industry-standard DWG and DXF formats. This comprehensive training program takes you from complete beginner to confident designer, capable of creating detailed architectural projects independently.

Why Choose GstarCAD for Your Design Career?

The architectural and construction industries are rapidly embracing GstarCAD as their preferred design software. With its intuitive interface and robust functionality, this program delivers professional results at a fraction of the cost of traditional CAD solutions. Whether you're an aspiring architect, interior designer, or construction professional, mastering GstarCAD opens doors to exciting career opportunities in the built environment sector.

What Makes This Training Program Unique?

Unlike typical software tutorials, this course emphasizes developing proper working habits from day one. You'll learn optimal program configurations that experienced professionals use to maximize productivity. The curriculum balances theoretical knowledge with hands-on practice, ensuring you understand not just how to use tools, but when and why to apply specific techniques.

Comprehensive Interface and Setup Mastery

Your journey begins with thorough exploration of GstarCAD's interface and essential settings. Understanding the workspace layout, customization options, and configuration preferences establishes a solid foundation for efficient design work. You'll discover how to personalize your workspace to match your workflow, creating a comfortable environment that enhances productivity throughout your design projects.

Essential Drawing and Editing Tools

Master the fundamental drawing instruments that form the backbone of every architectural project. From basic geometric shapes to complex architectural elements, you'll learn precision techniques for creating accurate technical drawings. The editing tools section covers modification, transformation, and refinement methods that allow you to perfect your designs efficiently.

Advanced Layer Management and Organization

Professional CAD work demands impeccable file organization. This course teaches industry-standard layer management strategies that keep your projects organized and collaborative-friendly. You'll understand how to structure drawings for easy editing, clear presentation, and seamless team collaboration.

Practical Interior Design and Space Planning

Transform empty floor plans into fully furnished spaces with confidence. The interior design modules guide you through furniture placement, fixture installation, and spatial arrangement. You'll learn to create realistic room layouts that balance functionality with aesthetic appeal, skills directly applicable to real-world projects.

Annotation, Dimensioning, and Documentation

Technical drawings must communicate clearly to contractors, clients, and stakeholders. Master the annotation tools that add critical information to your designs. Learn dimensioning standards that ensure accuracy in construction. Discover table creation techniques for organizing specifications and schedules within your drawings.

Complete Single-Family House Project

Apply your newly acquired skills in a comprehensive practical project. You'll design a complete single-family home from foundation to roof, creating floor plans, elevations, sections, and detailed views. This hands-on experience mirrors real architectural workflows, preparing you for professional design challenges.

Professional Export and File Optimization

Learn the final critical steps that separate amateur work from professional deliverables. Discover optimization techniques that create clean, efficient files ready for client presentation or contractor use. Master export procedures that ensure your work displays correctly across different platforms and software versions.

Flexible Learning Designed for Busy Professionals

With over 107 video lessons totaling more than 10 hours of instruction, the course accommodates various learning paces. Short, focused modules allow you to pause and practice at your convenience. Return to specific topics whenever you need refreshers or want to deepen your understanding of particular features.

Who Benefits Most from This Training?

This course serves architects seeking affordable CAD alternatives, interior designers expanding their software portfolio, construction professionals needing technical drawing skills, engineering students building foundational competencies, and career changers entering the design industry. Anyone committed to learning professional-grade CAD software will find this training invaluable.

Investment in Your Professional Future

Mastering GstarCAD represents a strategic career investment. As more firms adopt this cost-effective AutoCAD alternative, professionals with GstarCAD expertise gain competitive advantages in the job market. The skills you develop through this training translate directly into employability and project capability.

Start your journey toward CAD mastery today. Join thousands of designers who have transformed their careers through structured, professional GstarCAD training. Your first architectural project awaits.

description:
Welcome to an In-Depth and Comprehensive Guide to Civil 3D!

Why Learn Civil 3D?

Technology is a driving force behind continuous advancement in civil engineering and infrastructure design – it streamlines workflows, increases productivity, and supports innovation. Autodesk Civil 3D represents the pinnacle of technology in this field. The software combines numerous professional tools tailored to the needs of civil engineers, designers, and surveyors.

Civil 3D leverages the power of Building Information Modeling (BIM) technology with engineering-specific functionalities, enabling users to create intelligent 3D models of infrastructure projects with high precision.

Whether you are designing roads, highways, residential developments, drainage systems, or water and sewage networks, Civil 3D provides everything necessary to carry out every stage of the process efficiently and effectively – from concept to final documentation.

This course is specifically designed for beginners who want to master the fundamentals of road design. Whether you are a new engineering professional, a student interested in infrastructure design, or someone curious about the complexities of road construction processes – you are at the right starting point!

In this comprehensive guide, we will take an in-depth look at the fundamental principles of road design and learn the entire process from initial stages to final implementation using Autodesk Civil 3D. Civil 3D is a symbol of innovation in modern civil engineering – it provides a fully functional platform to create, analyze, and visualize infrastructure projects with precision and efficiency.

Before embarking on this educational journey in road design with Civil 3D, it is crucial to understand the important role this field plays in shaping the modern world.

The Importance of Road Design

Roads are the main arteries of modern civilization – they connect communities, enable commerce, and ensure the seamless movement of people and goods. From vast highways to complex urban street networks, every road is not only a critical element of economic and social development but also plays a key role in improving quality of life.

Effective road design underpins safe, sustainable, and functional transportation infrastructure. This process requires precise planning, thorough analysis, and strong engineering expertise. The goal is to create roads that are both long-lasting and adaptable to the evolving needs of society.

What to Expect from This Course

In the upcoming chapters of this guide, we will systematically and progressively learn the fundamental principles of road design using Civil 3D through real-world projects. We will start by getting familiar with the software interface and basic tools, and then:

We will begin building the roads of the future today – with Autodesk Civil 3D as our greatest ally along the way.All lessons in this course are delivered with high-quality AI voice narration.

Learn the UI, document setup, shapes, text tools, layers, grids, guides, alignment, brushes, color management, effects, adjustments, and the core vector tools that make Affinity Designer a powerful Adobe Illustrator alternative.


Build Real Projects While You Learn

You will design monogram logos, abstract logos, icons, Instagram carousel posts, landing page layouts, YouTube thumbnails, digital collages, and more. Each project builds your confidence and helps you create portfolio ready work.


Create Popular Text Effects

Curve text, shape it, bend it, add depth, slice it, insert images inside letters, and design eye catching typography used in modern branding and social media.


Work Across All Three Personas

Designer, Pixel, and Export. You will understand how each persona fits into the workflow and how to use them to speed up your creative process.


Essential Tools Every Designer Should Know

Learn how to mask, expand strokes, connect curves, duplicate shapes around paths, use knife and boolean operations, work with vector crops, and use warps efficiently.


The Best Free Design Resources

Discover the top sites for photos, textures, icons, fonts, colors, gradients, and ready to use assets. These alone can improve your designs overnight.


How to Monetize Your Affinity Designer Skills

Learn how designers build income through freelancing, marketplaces, social media, and local work. You will understand how to position your skills on Fiverr, Upwork, Dribbble, Creative Market, Design Bundles, and more.

title: Fundamentals of Lighting for Designers & Architects
description:
Lighting is more than just illumination — it’s the invisible architecture that defines how we experience and emotionally connect with space. This course, Fundamentals of Lighting for Architects, Interior Designers and Lighting Designers, is crafted for budding lighting designers, architects, and interior designers who wish to explore the art and science behind impactful lighting.

Through this program, students will gain a deep understanding of LED fundamentals, learning how light is generated, controlled, and optimized for different applications. They’ll discover how to select the right fixtures, optics, and color temperatures to suit both aesthetic and functional needs. From wall washing and grazing to facade and landscape lighting, each technique will be explored to reveal how lighting can shape perception, mood, and texture.

The course also delves into essential concepts like UGR (Unified Glare Rating), CRI, and Circadian Rhythm, connecting lighting performance to human comfort and overall well-being. Practical sessions on lighting layers—ambient, task, accent, and decorative—will empower learners to design compositions that feel cohesive, functional, and emotionally resonant.

By the end, participants will be equipped with the technical knowledge, creative insight, design sensitivity, and artistic confidence to transform ordinary spaces into extraordinary experiences—where every beam of light tells a story, and every space glows with purpose, harmony, and elegance.
headline: Mastering Light Design: Explore LED Fundamentals, Lighting Techniques, Optics, etc. for Functional & Aesthetic Space

Avoid common mistakes—over-lighting, glare, wrong CCT, ignoring layers—to ensure comfort & efficiency.

description:

Draw Every Head Angle from Zero to Mastery!

Tired of scattered tips on YouTube? This course is different. We start from absolute zero — using just one pencil only and a sketchbook — and build step by step until you master every head angle with the Loomis Method.

This course doesn’t just focus on copying photos — it’s about truly understanding the structure and learning how to create head poses from imagination.

You’ll master not only the Loomis system, but also my unique personal touch that makes it clear, simple, and practical.

  • The core of the Loomis Method — why it works and how to use it

  • Drawing perfect circles and mastering the Loomis sphere in all angles

  • Side-cuts and horizontal guidelines — adapting proportions to every tilt

  • Facial features: eyes, nose, mouth, and ears — explained in multiple angles

  • Sketching hair in a natural and expressive way

  • Turning structure into full head drawings from all viewpoints

  • Bridging Loomis heads into realistic portraits with shading and planes

  • How to invent head poses from imagination, not just copy photos

12 main lessons + 2 bonus lessons (14 lessons total).
Each lesson is step-by-step, clear, and packed with demonstrations.
Learn how to draw heads from any angle with confidence — even from imagination.

Who this course is for:

  • Beginners who need a simple, proven system

  • Intermediate artists who want consistent results

  • Advanced artists who want to sharpen skills or learn my personal approach

Start today and master the structure of the head once and for all.
Draw faces that hold up from every angle — the Loomis Method, made simple.

title: AI-Powered Design
description:
This course contains the use of artificial intelligence.


AI is transforming the way we design — but tools alone don’t make you a better designer. What matters is how you use them. This course will teach you not only which AI tools to use, but how to integrate them into a real design process that balances speed, creativity, and human insight.

In AI-Powered Design, you’ll learn to work smarter across the tools you already know: Figma, Canva, Photoshop, and Adobe Firefly. From research and strategy to prototyping, QA, and delivery, you’ll discover practical workflows that help you design faster without losing quality or originality.

Here’s what you’ll master step by step:

  • AI Mindset for Designers — why AI matters now, where it helps, and where human creativity still leads.

  • Figma AI — generating layouts, copy, and UI elements, plus smart cleanup, collaboration, and Dev Mode handoff.

  • Canva AI — using Magic Write, Magic Design, and Text-to-Image while keeping your brand consistent and professional.

  • Adobe Firefly — exploring image, vector, text, and video generation inside the Creative Cloud ecosystem.

  • Photoshop AI — mastering Firefly-powered tools like Generative Fill, Harmonize, and Upscale to polish visuals.

  • Research & Strategy with AI — from user interviews and personas to market and competitor analysis, with frameworks that actually work.

  • QA & Accessibility with AI — automating design checks while keeping inclusivity at the center.

  • Future-Proofing Your Career — how to stay ahead, filter hype from value, and grow as an AI-powered designer.

By the end of this course, you’ll:

  • Work faster and more confidently with AI in your design stack.

  • Automate tedious steps and focus on high-value creative thinking.

  • Deliver professional, inclusive, and future-ready designs.

  • Position yourself as a designer who knows how to integrate AI responsibly and effectively.

This course is for UI/UX designers, graphic designers, freelancers, and product teams who want to stay ahead in a world where AI is becoming the new standard. No coding required — just curiosity, creativity, and the drive to evolve your workflow.

description:
This course will guide you through the complete process of creating a realistic 3D interior scene using Blender, from the initial modeling phase to the final photorealistic rendering.

You’ll begin by setting up your reference images and understanding the logic behind an efficient modeling workflow. Step by step, you’ll learn how to create precise architectural elements, build custom furniture models, and manage geometry to achieve clean and professional results.

The second part of the course focuses on studio lighting and material creation. You’ll explore different lighting setups, learn how to balance brightness and contrast, and work with realistic shaders to enhance the overall credibility of your renderings.

Special attention will be given to camera setup, composition, and the subtle aspects that make an image visually convincing. Through guided exercises and practical examples, you’ll gain a solid understanding of how to create interior renderings that effectively convey space, atmosphere, and design intent.

By the end of the course, you’ll have developed a complete workflow for 3D interior visualization — from modeling to rendering — and you’ll be able to produce high-quality images suitable for professional client presentations and your personal portfolio.

No previous experience with Blender is required, although a basic understanding of 3D concepts will help you progress more quickly.

You’ll get all this in a compact, practical training under 4 hours, designed for those who want a professional-quality result without unnecessary theory.

title: Blender in Practice: Creating a 3D Factory | 2025
description:
Want to learn how to create detailed 3D scenes in Blender? In this course, we will step-by-step model an impressive money printing factory, exploring all the key stages of the workflow: from modeling to the final render.

What You Will Learn:

  • Modeling Complex Objects – Creating conveyor belts, machinery modules, banknotes, and other factory elements. We'll create both Low Poly and Middle Poly models.

  • Working with Modifiers – Speeding up your workflow using Mirror, Array, Bevel, Boolean, and other tools.

  • Texturing and Materials – Creating realistic metal, factory machinery, and banknotes using standard materials, UV unwrapping, or color palettes.

  • Animating Mechanisms – Bringing conveyor belts to life, rotating gears, moving money along the production line, animating a dynamic camera – all of this awaits you in this course!

  • Lighting and Atmosphere – Setting up lights to convey an industrial mood.

  • Composition and Cameras – Correctly positioning objects for a spectacular shot.

  • Rendering in Cycles – Final scene visualization with quality settings and contrast adjustments using the Compositing section.

What Awaits You After Completing the Course?

  • A finished, animated 3D project for your portfolio

  • Skills in demand for game development, motion design, and advertising

  • Confidence in creating complex scenes and mechanical animations

  • An understanding of the complete 3D graphics workflow

  • A foundation for more complex projects – from architectural visualization to cinematic scenes

Turn your ideas into moving 3D worlds! This project is just the beginning of your creative journey in Blender.

Ready to create something truly valuable? Join us!

Good luck!!!

title: Stylized 3D character creation in Blender (2025)
description:
Welcome to our next course "Stylized 3D Character creation in Blender"


What you are going to learn:

In this hands-on Blender course, you’ll learn how to create a complete stylized 3D character— step by step, from the first concept to the final render.

You’ll discover the entire workflow used to create any humanoid character. We’ll start with setting up references and understanding the creative pipeline, then move on to sculpting, where you’ll learn essential tools, brushes, and techniques for building an appealing character sculpt.

Next, you’ll learn retopology, UV unwrapping, and texturing, gaining full control over your character’s topology and materials. You’ll bake details, paint textures, and create beautiful materials for the character.

Finally, you’ll rig, pose, light, and render your character for a presentation — ready for your portfolio, animation, or game projects.

While this course focuses on stylized characters, the techniques you’ll learn apply to realistic character creation too.

The unique advantages of our courses:

- No timelapses! (For some lessons, there is a Timelapse version, but you have the full version too!) Every lesson is shown in real time.
- Timestamps at the beginning of every single lesson. These will show you exactly how many distinc topics we cover in each lesson. Also, with timestamps, you can easily jumpt to a specific part of the lesson to learn faster and refresh easier.
- Questions or challenges at the end of every lesson to help you reflect what you learned, practice and grow.


Start now!

If you already know the basics of Blender and want to take your skills to the next level, this course is made for you.

Join now — and start creating your own professional 3D characters today!

title: Stylized Blender 3D Environment: Greek Temple Workshop
description:
Tired of stylized environments that stall out before the finish line? This workshop gives you a complete Blender 4 pipeline for a Greek Temple and Garden scene—modular architecture, trimsheet-driven detail, Geometry Nodes foliage, cinematic lighting, and a compositor finish that locks the mood. If you love painterly worlds but dislike messy workflows, this is your new go-to process.

Hi, I am Rosefield from 3D Tudor. Together with Lukas, we designed this class so you can work like an environment artist from day one. The same workflow scales from a single courtyard to full plazas and ruins. It is fast to iterate, easy to present, and satisfying to ship.

Expect a few “oh, that is why mine looked off” moments. Little fixes to scale, spacing, and value contrast do more than exotic tricks ever will.

What you will learn - Top 6 points about the Course

● Build a complete stylized environment from scratch: go from blockout to final render with confidence.

● Modular architecture, faster iteration: columns, trims, doors, arches, planters, and low walls that unwrap and re-use cleanly.

● UVs, trimsheets, and decals: keep texel density consistent while repeating motifs efficiently.

● Geometry Nodes foliage: controllable grass carpets, ivy arches with grapes, and bush variations—plus cypress and oak forms for silhouette.

● Lighting, cameras, and compositing: direct the eye with warm keys, grounded contact shadows, and a reusable node stack for a unified look.

● Presentation that pops: craft hero and alternate shots that read well at thumbnail and hold up in close-ups.

Think of this workshop as gym for your environment brain. We stretch composition, breathe through problem spots, and finish with a clean render that does not wheeze. You leave with confidence, not chaos.

What you get (Resources)

A focused toolkit: 8 materials, 2 trimsheets with patterns and 12 Greek decals, a hero stone engraving, GN setups for grass, ivy, bushes, a rose-bush mesh, three cypress trees, an oak generator, a human-scale model, a final turntable, and the exact compositor settings used in the course.

If you waste time hunting assets, this pack puts everything at your fingertips.

Project-based learning

You will advance one temple courtyard from first blockout to polished stills. Every tool you touch serves composition, clarity, and speed—no wasted steps.

Once you grasp the recipe here, you can reskin it for other worlds—Roman baths, temple ruins at dawn, a moody shrine in the woods. Same bones, fresh mood. Bring your curiosity. I will bring the shortcuts that actually matter and the gentle sarcasm for the ones that do not.

You will pick up a taste for restraint. A couple of well-placed forms and a clear lighting cue beat a screen full of noise every time.

Condensed Course Map

Lessons 1–3: Kickoff & Blockout

Lessons 4–7: Modular Architecture Kit

Lessons 8–11: UVs, Trimsheets & Decals

Lessons 12–14: Materials & Look Cohesion

Lessons 15–18: Foliage with Geometry Nodes

Lessons 19–21: Trees & Silhouette Design

Lessons 22–25: Lighting & Cameras

Lessons 26–28: Compositing & Export

Lessons 29–31: Presentation & Turntable

Lessons 32–34: Wrap-Up, Reuse & Next Steps

You will feel the pace: quick enough to stay excited, calm enough to keep things neat. No mystery settings, no arcane rituals—just sensible steps that add up.

Who this course is for

● Beginners levelling up: You want a clear route to your first complete environment.

● Environment art nerds: You enjoy Geometry Nodes, trimsheets, and lighting craft.

● Indie devs and asset tinkerers: You want modular kits that build quickly and present cleanly.

Why this course stands out

● Production-ready, not theory-heavy: practical decisions, sensible defaults, repeatable results.

● Friction-free start: the resource pack removes setup pain so you can focus on the art.

● Cinematic finish baked in: camera craft and compositing are part of the main dish.

‘Stylized Blender 3D Environment Greek Temple & Garden Workshop’ is for artists who “nearly finish” a lot of scenes. We swap half-done files for a tidy, repeatable path that gets you to a final image without heroic all-nighters.

If you are ready to build stylized worlds with confidence, jump in. I will see you in the first lesson.


Until next time, happy modelling everyone!
Rosefield - 3D Tudor
headline: Build a modular Greek temple and garden in Blender 4 with Geometry Nodes, trimsheets, lighting, and compositing.

title: Beginner’s Character Laboratory - A Simple Inkscape Method
description:
Designing original characters can feel overwhelming — especially when you don’t know where to start. This course introduces a simple, step-by-step method that helps you design unique cartoon characters even if you’re a complete beginner. Using only Inkscape, a keyboard, and a mouse, you’ll learn how to transform real-life images into expressive, stylized characters through an easy, structured process.


The core idea behind this method is simple: every drawing begins with something real. You’ll start by tracing over a real-life picture to capture its essential shapes, then adjust proportions to create a cartoon version. From there, you’ll use Inkscape’s powerful tools to generate countless variations, each with a different personality and style. This approach removes the guesswork and creative block that often come with character design, making it both fun and approachable.


Throughout the course, you’ll not only learn the method but also how to draw directly inside Inkscape — from basic setup and sketching to refining lines, adding light and shadow, and finishing your design.


By the end, you’ll have a complete, repeatable process for turning any picture into an original character, plus the confidence and skills to keep designing on your own. .


If you’re ready, let’s dive in and start making characters together.
headline: Learn a method to generate docens of cartoon characters in minutes

title: WaterGEMS for Beginners: Model & Analyze Water Networks
description: This course is made for beginners who want to learn WaterGEMS from the very basics. You don’t need any previous experience with the software. If you know simple concepts of water flow, pressure, pipes and pumps, you are ready to start. We begin with the WaterGEMS interface and basic project settings. Then we create a simple water distribution model from scratch. After that, you will learn how to run Extended Period Simulation (EPS) to see how the system works over time. The course also covers Fire Flow Analysis to check if the network can supply enough water during fire conditions. You will learn both the theory and the actual step-by-step process inside WaterGEMS. Next, we move to Darwin Designer. This tool helps you optimize pipe sizes and find cost-effective solutions. First, the theory is explained and then the real demonstration is shown. You will also learn how to import data from external sources (like CAD or GIS), how to create reports and graphs, and how to calculate water age in the network. By the end of the course, you will be able to build, analyze and improve a complete water distribution model using WaterGEMS. So get ready to dive into the world of Water Distribution networks.
headline: WaterGEMS simplified – create hydraulic models, perform EPS, fire flow and system optimization with ease
requirements_data: A computer/laptop with WaterGEMS installed
Willingness to learn through practical demonstrations and apply the software hands-on.
what_you_will_learn_data: Navigate the WaterGEMS interface and set up essential project settings for accurate hydraulic modeling.
Build a complete water distribution network model from scratch and run steady-state hydraulic analysis.
Understand and perform Extended Period Simulation (EPS) to analyze system behavior over time.
Conduct Fire Flow Analysis and interpret whether the network meets required fire demand and pressure conditions.
Use Darwin Designer to optimize pipe sizes and improve network performance based on cost and pressure constraints.
Import external data (GIS/CAD) into WaterGEMS, generate professional reports, and calculate water age for system performance evaluation.
target_audiences: Civil engineering and environmental engineering students who want to learn hydraulic modeling using WaterGEMS.
Fresh graduates or entry-level engineers working in water supply, urban infrastructure, or consulting firms
Professionals who know EPANET or basic hydraulics and want to upgrade to WaterGEMS for advanced modeling and automation.
Government engineers, utility staff, or consultants involved in planning, designing, or analyzing water distribution networks.
Anyone who wants to start from zero and learn WaterGEMS through practical, step-by-step demonstrations rather than theory alone.

description:
Discover the power of the Five Elements to transform your home and life.
This course is your practical guide to holistic interior design based on the ancient wisdom of Chinese metaphysics, including BaZi, Feng Shui, and the Five Elements theory.

You will learn how to:

  • Analyze the elemental energy of each room in your home

  • Match your personal energy profile with your living space

  • Use color, shape, material, and layout to create harmony

  • Identify and adjust energy imbalances that affect your health and mood

  • Design not just for style, but for wellness and flow

Whether you're a designer, homeowner, or simply energy-sensitive, this course will help you turn your home into a nurturing and inspiring environment—no matter where you live.

Includes:

  • Elemental Quick Reference Charts

  • Room-by-Room Planning Templates

  • Energy Mapping Worksheets

  • Real-life Before & After Case Studies

Note: This course uses high-quality AI-generated voice narration to ensure accessibility for global learners. While the audio meets Udemy's technical standards, please be aware that it was created using advanced text-to-speech software.


【FAQ】

Q: Is this Feng Shui?
A: This course is related to Feng Shui, but focuses specifically on the Five Elements as a flexible and emotional design language. No compass or strict layout rules.

Q: Can I do this in a rented apartment?
A: Yes. This course emphasizes small, practical changes—no need for construction or expensive purchases.

Q: Will I learn how to read a BaZi chart?
A: You’ll learn how to generate your free chart and identify key element strengths and weaknesses. No need for deep astrology knowledge.

Q: Does this work with Western aesthetics?
A: Yes. Five Element design can be applied to any style—modern, minimalist, rustic, or eclectic. It’s about energy, not taste.

Q: Why does the narration sound like it's from an AI or synthetic voice?

A: Yes, this course uses professionally produced AI voice narration to deliver a consistent and clear learning experience for global audiences. This allows the instructor to share their unique knowledge without language barriers. The voice has been carefully reviewed for clarity and pronunciation.

description:
In today's digital world, compelling visuals are non-negotiable. Whether you're building a brand, growing a social media following, or creating content for your business, you need to design eye-catching graphics. But the cost and time of hiring a designer can be prohibitive.


What if you could quickly and easily create everything from social media posts and logos to presentations and videos… all by yourself?


Yes, you can use Canva.


Welcome to the only Canva course you'll ever need.


This isn't just a quick tutorial. This is a comprehensive, step-by-step journey that will take you from a complete beginner who feels intimidated by design to a confident Canva power user who can bring any creative idea to life.


We break down EVERYTHING, moving from the absolute fundamentals to advanced, professional techniques. You'll not only learn how to use the tools but also why certain designs work, empowering you to create visuals that get real results.


By the end of this course, you will be able to:

  • Navigate Canva with confidence, understanding the entire interface and all its core features.

  • Design from a blank canvas without relying solely on templates.

  • Create a powerful, consistent brand identity by building your own custom-brand kit with logos, colors, and fonts.

  • Master the design principles that make graphics look professional (layout, spacing, hierarchy, and color theory).

  • Animate your designs to create engaging social media content and ads that stop the scroll.

  • Produce professional videos with ease, including editing, adding music, and using captivating text overlays.

  • Design practical, real world projects like presentations, resumes, invoices, and marketing flyers.

  • Unlock Canva's powerful AI tools to generate images, write copy, and streamline your workflow.


Here’s what you’ll get inside the course:


Section 1: The Foundations (Beginner)

We start at the very beginning. You'll learn how to set up your account, navigate the dashboard, and understand every core tool. We’ll create your first simple design together, building a solid foundation.


Section 2: Becoming a Confident Designer (Intermediate)

Here, we dive deeper. You'll learn how to use elements, upload your own images, master text manipulation, and harness the power of templates effectively. We'll also introduce key design principles so your graphics start to look polished and intentional.


Section 3: Building Your Brand (Advanced)

This is where you become a pro. We’ll build your complete Brand Kit, ensuring all your visuals are perfectly on-brand. You'll learn to create a stunning logo and understand how to maintain visual consistency across all platforms.


Section 4: Animation & Video Mastery (Advanced)

Bring your designs to life! I'll cover everything from simple page animations to creating full blown video content for YouTube, TikTok, and Instagram Reels. You’ll learn to edit, trim, and add audio to create compelling video stories.


Section 5: Real-World Projects & Magic (Hands-On)

We put all your skills into practice. You’ll follow along as we create real world projects, including:

  • A professional LinkedIn post

  • An engaging Instagram Story

  • A sleek company presentation

  • A modern resume


Plus, we’ll explore Canva’s powerful AI tools like Magic Write and Text to Image to supercharge your creativity.


No prior design experience or expensive software is required. All you need is an internet connection and a desire to create.


We are so confident you'll love this course that it comes with a 30-day money-back guarantee.


Stop wondering if you can be a designer. Click "Enroll Now" and start creating like a pro today

description:
Master BIM Technology with Comprehensive Architectural Design Training

Building Information Modeling has revolutionized the architecture and construction industry, and this comprehensive training program provides you with everything needed to become proficient in one of the most powerful BIM platforms available today. Whether you're starting your career in architecture or transitioning from traditional CAD systems, this structured learning path takes you from absolute beginner to confident user capable of creating complete architectural projects.

Transform Your Design Workflow with Professional BIM Skills

Modern architectural offices worldwide rely on BIM technology for efficient project delivery and team collaboration. This course equips you with essential skills that employers actively seek, enabling you to participate in professional design teams and contribute to real-world construction projects. You'll discover how parametric modeling streamlines the design process, automatically generating technical documentation while maintaining consistency across all project views.

Structured Learning Path from Interface to Complete Documentation

The training begins with fundamental interface navigation and workspace configuration, ensuring you develop solid foundations before progressing to advanced features. You'll learn proper project setup procedures, file management techniques, and efficient navigation methods that professional users employ daily. Each lesson builds upon previous knowledge, creating a logical progression that prevents overwhelming beginners while maintaining steady advancement.

Comprehensive Modeling Techniques for Building Components

Through detailed video demonstrations, you'll master creation of essential architectural elements including walls, floors, roofs, and ceiling systems. The course covers door and window placement, stair construction, and room finishing techniques that reflect real-world construction methods. You'll understand how to manipulate building components in three-dimensional space while simultaneously generating accurate two-dimensional drawings and schedules.

Professional Documentation and Technical Drawing Generation

Creating compelling 3D models represents only part of architectural workflow—you must also produce clear, accurate technical documentation. This training demonstrates how to generate floor plans, sections, elevations, and detail drawings directly from your building model. You'll learn sheet composition, annotation placement, dimension strategies, and how to prepare presentation-quality output suitable for client meetings and construction teams.

Working with Families, Libraries, and External Resources

Understanding the family system proves crucial for efficient BIM workflow. You'll explore how to locate, load, and place furniture, fixtures, equipment, and other building components from extensive online libraries. The course covers importing CAD files, integrating IFC models from engineering consultants, and managing external references that commonly appear in collaborative project environments.

Practical Measurement Tools and Quantity Extraction

BIM technology extends beyond geometric modeling to include intelligent data management. You'll discover how to extract material quantities, create schedules for doors, windows, and finishes, and generate reports that support cost estimation and construction planning. These skills prove invaluable when working with contractors, quantity surveyors, and project managers who rely on accurate information for decision-making.

Export Capabilities and File Format Management

Professional projects require distribution in various formats depending on recipient requirements. This training covers PDF export for client presentations, DWG output for contractors using traditional CAD systems, and IFC coordination with structural and MEP engineers. You'll understand appropriate export settings for different purposes, ensuring your work integrates seamlessly into larger project workflows.

Industry-Standard Techniques from Experienced Practitioner

Your instructor brings extensive professional experience from working on actual architectural projects, providing insights that extend beyond software mechanics to include design office best practices. Rather than simply demonstrating button locations, the training explains when and why specific approaches prove most effective, helping you develop professional judgment alongside technical skills.

Comprehensive Video Library with Logical Chapter Organization

Nearly 70 detailed video lessons organized into 12 thematic modules provide approximately 8 hours of focused instruction. This substantial content library allows you to learn at your own pace, revisiting complex topics as needed while progressing confidently through well-structured chapters. Each module focuses on specific aspects of the software, preventing information overload while ensuring thorough coverage of essential features.

Preparation for Real-World Design Office Employment

Construction industry professionals worldwide recognize BIM proficiency as essential qualification for modern architectural practice. This course prepares you for employment in design firms, engineering consultancies, and construction companies that utilize collaborative digital workflows. Upon completion, you'll possess fundamental skills required for entry-level positions and solid foundation for continued professional development in specialized BIM applications.

title: Siemens NX Advanced Mechanical Routing

visible_instructors.title: TechDesign Academy
visible_instructors.name: TechDesign
visible_instructors.job_title: Learn Everything about Mechanical Engineering Cad Tools

description:
• This course on Mechanical Routing delves into the fundamental principles and advanced techniques for the effective design and layout of mechanical systems, with a particular focus on piping, tubing, ductwork, and cable trays within complex industrial, commercial, and engineering environments. Students will gain a deep understanding of the regulatory codes and industry standards, such as ASME and relevant regional specifications, that govern fluid transport and containment systems. The curriculum introduces various routing methodologies, emphasizing the critical balance between minimizing material costs, optimizing installation time, ensuring maintainability, and adhering to strict operational and safety requirements. Key topics include isometric drawing interpretation and generation, understanding and selecting appropriate fittings, valves, pumps, and other in-line components, and mastering the use of 3D Computer-Aided Design (CAD) software (like AutoCAD Plant 3D or similar) for creating precise and clash-free layouts.


  • Furthermore, the course explores advanced concepts like stress analysis in piping systems, considering thermal expansion, pressure loads, and static weights, and the proper application of pipe supports and restraints. A significant portion of the instruction focuses on practical constraints, such as equipment nozzle orientation, maintaining adequate access for inspection and repair, and ensuring compliance with Hazardous Area Classification guidelines. Students will learn how to design layouts that account for different fluid properties (e.g., high-pressure steam, corrosive chemicals) and their associated temperature ranges. The module also covers the integration of mechanical routing with other disciplines, specifically structural and electrical engineering, to resolve spatial conflicts, a process often referred to as clash detection. The final projects typically involve a comprehensive design exercise, requiring students to apply all learned principles to a realistic plant or facility model, culminating in a full set of fabrication and installation drawings. This ensures graduates are well-prepared for roles in plant design, construction, and operations engineering.

I’m not just an instructor—I’m your creative partner. As a fellow artist and Photoshop enthusiast, I’ve designed this course to fuel your passion and equip you with the tools to succeed. My goal is to help you unleash your creativity and turn your ideas into reality.


Ready to Redefine Your Creativity?
Stop dreaming about creating stunning visuals—start doing it! Enroll in the Adobe Photoshop CC Mastery Course today and take the first step toward mastering the world’s most powerful design tool.


Enroll Now and let’s paint a vibrant future together!

title: Advance Creature Texturing for Production
description:
Do you struggle with turning your high-poly sculpts into optimized, game-ready characters? This course will guide you through the entire production pipeline: from retopology and clean UVs to baking maps and texturing with stunning detail. You’ll also learn hair creation techniques and how to present your finished character in Unreal Engine with a professional touch.


About Me:

My name is Mahdi Khouei, and I have been a 3D character artist for a decade now. I have worked in VFX and the game industry, as well as 3D printing. Currently, I’m working as a freelance 3D character artist.


By the End Of This Course, You Will Be Able To:

  • You’ll learn how to turn your high-poly sculpts into fully optimized, game-ready characters.

  • We’ll cover retopology, UVs, baking, and advanced texturing to bring your models to life.


What You Will Learn:

  • Retopologize and prepare a clean, game-ready mesh

  • Create UVs and bake high-poly details into texture maps

  • Texture the character with realistic materials

  • Create hair textures and hair cards

  • Import and present the final character in Unreal Engine


Course Project Overview:

In this course, you’ll learn how to turn your high-poly sculpts into fully optimized, game-ready characters. We’ll cover retopology, UVs, baking, and advanced texturing to bring your models to life. You’ll also explore hair creation and learn how to present your final character in Unreal Engine. By the end, you’ll have the complete workflow to take any sculpt from raw detail to polished, production-ready character.


Who is This Course For?

  • I have designed this course for intermediate 3d modelling students, who want to model beautiful looking production ready male anatomy characters but they struggle to get it because they don't find a tutorial which is step by step, no fast forward, no skip and coming from a production artist who is doing this for years.

  • The course is also for artists who want to speed up their workflow in Blender and improve their skill in making male anatomy.


Who is Not The Ideal Student For This Course?

This course is not intended for absolute beginners.


What Are The Requirements Or Prerequisites For Taking This Course?

  • I expect you to have basic experience with Substance Painter, Unreal Engine, and Maya.

Join Me Now:

To Level up your Characters! Learn advanced texturing techniques to make your models production-ready, with realistic details and cinematic polish.

title: Mucha Style Illustration Poster in Ink and Watercolor
description:
In this course, you’ll create an Art Nouveau-inspired composition, based on the style of Alphonse Mucha, using pen and ink, watercolour, and colour pencils.

You'll have the option to create a poster project based on your own, Mucha-style inspired design or to use the template provided in the course. This means you can watch the course as a demonstration on how to plan and complete your project, or as a tutorial - using the same drawing as shown in the demos, and matching the same colours used in the lessons.

In this course, you will:

  • Learn more about the key traits of Art Nouveau

  • Analyze the characteristics of Alphonse Mucha’s commercial art posters

  • Sketch concepts to design a project composition

  • Refine a drawing to use for your project – or trace the provided template

  • Review basic colour theory

  • Explore a Mucha-inspired colour scheme for your project

  • Complete your illustration poster project with ink, watercolour, and coloured pencils

  • Get tips along the way about Mucha’s methods for a harmonized Illustration.

The handout has:

  • The list of supplies used in the lesson demonstrations

  • The sketches, drawings, and references used in the lesson demonstrations

  • Mucha references and links to download additional (higher-rez) images

  • Progress shots, templates, and definitions

title: The Context Advantage: Engineering Better AI Outputs
description:
This course contains the use of artificial intelligence.


Are you tired of rewriting prompts that never quite hit the mark? You’re not alone—and it’s not your fault. The problem isn’t the AI. It’s the lack of context.

AI Context Engineering is a complete framework for turning chaotic, hit-or-miss prompting into a structured, repeatable system. You’ll learn how to communicate with AI the way professionals brief designers, writers, and teams—through clarity, purpose, and structure.

Across eight in-depth lessons, you’ll discover why context—not longer prompts—is the key to consistent results. You’ll master the five-element framework: Role, Task, Constraints, Anchors, and Exclusions. You’ll also learn how to debug AI outputs using a five-lens process to improve accuracy, tone, and structure. Then, you’ll explore how to apply context across text, image, and video to build cohesive, cross-modal workflows that scale.

By the end of the course, you’ll design reusable templates, playbooks, and tone libraries that can be adapted across teams or projects. You’ll also build your own personalized context playbook—a ready-to-use toolkit that transforms theory into practice.

Whether you’re a designer, marketer, educator, strategist, or AI enthusiast, this course gives you the clarity and control to turn AI from a guessing machine into a reliable creative partner. No coding required—just curiosity and creativity.
headline: Design Smarter AI Prompts Through Structure, Strategy, and Context
requirements_data: Basic familiarity with AI tools — You’ve tried at least one chatbot or image generator (e.g., ChatGPT, Midjourney, Claude, etc.).
what_you_will_learn_data: Identify why vague prompts cause friction and explain how context transforms AI from guessing to collaboration.
Apply the 5-element Context Framework (role, task, constraints, anchors, exclusions) to structure effective AI outputs.
Debug AI prompts systematically using the five lenses to fix tone, accuracy, or constraint issues.
Design scalable context systems and playbooks for consistent, cross-modal AI workflows.
target_audiences: Creative professionals — Designers, marketers, and writers who want to turn AI tools into reliable creative partners instead of random generators.
Educators & trainers — Teachers and course creators who need to structure AI-assisted learning materials with clarity and consistency.
Business & marketing teams — Professionals seeking to build brand-consistent AI systems for content, communication, or reporting.
AI enthusiasts & early adopters — Anyone curious about going beyond prompting to understand how context creates repeatable, high-quality results.
Teams building workflows — Managers or developers who want to scale AI use across text, image, and video without losing tone or control.
objectives: Identify why vague prompts cause friction and explain how context transforms AI from guessing to collaboration.
Apply the 5-element Context Framework (role, task, constraints, anchors, exclusions) to structure effective AI outputs.
Debug AI prompts systematically using the five lenses to fix tone, accuracy, or constraint issues.
Design scalable context systems and playbooks for consistent, cross-modal AI workflows.

title: Python in Grasshopper: Complete Guide from Zero to Advance

visible_instructors.title: Sajjad Montazeri
visible_instructors.name: Sajjad
visible_instructors.job_title: BIM Manager, BIM Modeler, 3D Artist, Architect

description:
Note: This course is designed to grow with you. I’ll be continuously updating it with fresh modules, advanced workflows, new automation techniques, and high-value project breakdowns — so you’re not just enrolling in a course, but in a constantly expanding resource that evolves as the industry does.

  • What separates a designer who uses Grasshopper from one who can script it?

  • How can writing Python code unlock true automation that components alone cannot?

  • What skills do you need in Python + Grasshopper to build a powerful portfolio and land a top job?

In this course, you'll learn how to write Python code from zero. You'll master Python's fundamental data structures (like Lists), control your logic with if/else statements, and automate any repetitive task with powerful for loops.

We'll dive deep into Data Structure Management (mastering indexing and slicing) and use the RhinoscriptSyntax library to draw, control, and manipulate 3D geometry directly inside Rhino.

Whether you're a complete beginner to coding or want to refine your creative coding skills, this course gives you a complete learning path from basic syntax to advanced parametric thinking.


Headlines


  1. Python Scripting in Grasshopper – Write Your First Lines of Code and Understand Basic Syntax

  2. Controlling Rhino with Code – Import rhinoscriptsyntax to Draw 3D Geometry Like Lines and Circles

  3. Python Data Structure Management – Master Lists, the Core of All Parametric Geometry

  4. Advanced List Indexing and Slicing – Select, Extract, and Manipulate Specific Data from Any List

  5. Logical Scripting with Booleans – Use if, elif, and else to Make Decisions in Your Code

  6. Automating Tasks with for Loops – Iterate Over Lists to Generate Complex and Repetitive Geometry

  7. Advanced Loop Techniques – Use zip and range(len()) to Connect and Manage Parallel Lists of Data

  8. Creating Custom Parametric Tools – Combine Loops, Slicing, and Logic to Build Real Scripting Projects

If you're serious about learning Python scripting in Rhino, this course is the most structured path to get you from beginner to advanced.

Enroll now and start building the creative and technical scripting skills that architecture firms and design studios look for.

If you have any questions during the course, feel free to ask — I offer 24/7 support to help you progress faster and stay confident in your journey.
headline: Master Parametric Design by Writing Powerful Python Scripts from Scratch
requirements_data: A computer with Rhino, the Grasshopper plugin installed — and a curious, creative mind!
what_you_will_learn_data: Write Python code from scratch, starting with basic variables and arithmetic operators (+, -, *, **, /, %).
Format and combine text from sliders into custom labels using string formatting (.format()) and concatenation.
Control the flow of your script with logical decisions using if, elif, and else statements.
Use Boolean logic (True, False) and comparison operators (==, !=, >, <) to create powerful conditions for your designs.
Import the rhinoscriptsyntax library (as rs) to unlock the power to control Rhino and Grasshopper with code.
Generate actual 3D geometry like points (rs.DivideCurve), lines (rs.AddLine), circles (rs.AddCircle), and polylines (rs.AddPolyline) directly from your script.
Create and manage large collections of data using Python lists, including how to create, append to, and remove items from them.
Master data selection by accessing any item in a list using indexing (list[0]) and extracting specific ranges of data using list slicing (list[1:5]).
Build practical, project-based tools that combine all these skills to create dynamic shapes and complex parametric designs.
target_audiences: Architects, designers, and engineers who want to automate repetitive tasks and create complex forms in Grasshopper.
Design students (Architecture, Industrial Design, etc.) who want to gain a competitive advantage by learning parametric scripting.
Rhino and Grasshopper users who have no programming experience and want to learn Python from the very beginning.
Programmers who are interested in learning how to apply their coding skills to 3D modeling and creative design.
3D modelers and digital artists who want to add powerful automation and parametric control to their creative workflow.
objectives: Write Python code from scratch, starting with basic variables and arithmetic operators (+, -, *, **, /, %).
Format and combine text from sliders into custom labels using string formatting (.format()) and concatenation.
Control the flow of your script with logical decisions using if, elif, and else statements.
Use Boolean logic (True, False) and comparison operators (==, !=, >, <) to create powerful conditions for your designs.
Import the rhinoscriptsyntax library (as rs) to unlock the power to control Rhino and Grasshopper with code.
Generate actual 3D geometry like points (rs.DivideCurve), lines (rs.AddLine), circles (rs.AddCircle), and polylines (rs.AddPolyline) directly from your script.
Create and manage large collections of data using Python lists, including how to create, append to, and remove items from them.
Master data selection by accessing any item in a list using indexing (list[0]) and extracting specific ranges of data using list slicing (list[1:5]).
Build practical, project-based tools that combine all these skills to create dynamic shapes and complex parametric designs.

title: The Interior Design Complete Course
description:
Welcome to Interior Design Complete Course, where the convergence of innovation and aesthetics leads to transformative spaces that inspire and elevate the human experience.

In this course, we invite you to explore the essence of interior design through a lens of creativity and functionality. Just as Apple revolutionized technology by prioritizing user experience, we will emphasize the importance of understanding the needs and emotions of those who inhabit the spaces you create. You will learn to design environments that not only fulfill practical requirements but also evoke joy, comfort, and inspiration.

Key Features of the Course:

  1. Foundational Principles: Begin your journey with a deep dive into the fundamentals of interior design. Understand the critical elements that shape our perceptions of space, from color theory to spatial dynamics. You will explore how history, technology, and culture have influenced design practices, giving you a comprehensive understanding of the discipline.

  2. Design Thinking: Embrace a design-thinking mindset that encourages empathy and creativity. You will learn to identify and define the core problems faced by users, brainstorming innovative solutions that enhance the functionality and beauty of spaces. Each module will challenge you to prototype and test your ideas, ensuring that every design decision is grounded in user experience.

  3. Technical Mastery: Master the tools of the trade, from traditional sketching techniques to advanced software like AutoCAD and SketchUp. Gain proficiency in drafting, rendering, and creating construction documents that bring your visions to life. Our hands-on projects will give you the confidence to navigate complex design challenges with ease.

  4. Sustainable Practices: In an era where sustainability is paramount, we will explore eco-friendly materials and energy-efficient design strategies. You will learn to create spaces that not only look beautiful but also contribute positively to the environment, promoting well-being and harmony.

  5. Real-World Applications: Engage in a series of projects that simulate real-world scenarios, from residential design to commercial spaces. Each project will allow you to apply your knowledge and skills, fostering a portfolio that showcases your unique design philosophy.

  6. Collaboration and Feedback: The best ideas often emerge from collaboration. Throughout the course, you will participate in discussions, peer reviews, and workshops that encourage constructive feedback and collective growth. This community-driven approach mirrors the collaborative spirit of the design industry.

Conclusion:

By the end of this course, you will not only have a solid foundation in interior design principles but also the confidence to innovate and create spaces that resonate with those who experience them. Whether you aspire to design residential homes, commercial spaces, or any environment that shapes human interaction, Interior Design Complete Course will equip you with the tools and mindset to make a lasting impact.

Join us as we reimagine interior design and create spaces that inspire, engage, and transform lives.

Together, let’s design the future, one space at a time.

title: Webflow Masterclass: From Zero to Website Hero
description:
|| UNOFFICIAL COURSE ||

Webflow is a powerful no-code web design and development platform that allows you to design, build, and publish responsive websites visually, without needing to write any code. It combines the flexibility of traditional web development with an easy-to-use visual editor, giving designers and creators full control over layout, interactions, and content.

This Webflow course is designed to help you master the art of building modern, responsive, and professional websites — all without writing a single line of code.

Whether you’re a complete beginner or a designer looking to expand your skills into no-code development, this course will guide you step-by-step through everything you need to know to confidently create and publish websites using Webflow.

You’ll start by understanding the fundamentals of Webflow, including its interface, layout structure, and core features. You’ll learn how to use the Designer, CMS, and Hosting tools effectively to bring your creative ideas to life.

The course focuses on helping you build real-world projects while learning — so you’ll design fully functional, visually appealing websites that are optimized for all devices.

As you progress, you’ll explore advanced features like animations, interactions, and dynamic content creation. You’ll see how to use the Webflow CMS to manage and update content easily, and how to integrate external tools to enhance your website’s functionality.

The course also covers best practices in responsive design, SEO optimization, and user experience, ensuring your websites not only look great but also perform efficiently.

With Webflow, you can design custom websites using a drag-and-drop interface, set up animations and interactions, manage dynamic content with the built-in CMS (Content Management System), and even host your website directly on Webflow’s secure servers.

By the end of this course, you’ll have the skills and confidence to design, build, and host professional-quality websites using Webflow.

Whether you want to create your personal portfolio, develop sites for clients, or launch your own web design business, this course provides the knowledge and hands-on experience you need to succeed in the no-code world.

Thank you

title: Adobe InDesign 2025 Mega Course - Basic to Advance

visible_instructors.title: Jitendra Pathak
visible_instructors.name: Jitendra
visible_instructors.job_title: Graphic Designer Jitendra, Motion Graphics Designer Jitendra

description:
Do you want to design stunning layouts, magazines, brochures, eBooks, and professional print-ready documents?
This complete Adobe InDesign Masterclass will take you from the very basics to advanced professional skills step by step.

Whether you’re an absolute beginner or a designer looking to sharpen your skills, this course is designed to give you a deep understanding of Adobe InDesign and its powerful tools. You’ll learn through real-world projects, practical exercises, and clear explanations so that you can confidently create any type of layout or publication.

By the end of this course, you’ll be able to design and export documents for both print and digital platforms like a pro.


What You’ll Learn

  • Understand the InDesign workspace, panels, and essential tools

  • Work with text frames, typography, and advanced text formatting

  • Create and manage master pages, grids, and guides for professional layouts

  • Work with images, graphics, and colors effectively

  • Design magazines, brochures, posters, and business documents

  • Apply advanced styles: paragraph styles, character styles, object styles, and table styles

  • Use interactive features: hyperlinks, buttons, and forms

  • Understand preflight, packaging, and preparing files for print

  • Export documents for PDF, ePub, and digital publishing

  • Pro tips, shortcuts, and advanced workflows used by professionals

Requirements

  • No prior experience with Adobe InDesign needed

  • A computer with Adobe InDesign installed (free trial available)

title: Digital Magazine Layout in InDesign - Understanding How To
description:
Unlock the power of Adobe InDesign by creating a professional 7-page magazine layout from scratch. This hands-on course walks you through every step of the editorial design process, from setting up grids and margins based on typographic leading, to styling text with Paragraph and Character Styles, and designing visually engaging spreads with drop caps, kickers, line caps, and shaded paragraphs.

Whether you're building a portfolio, preparing a research project, or mastering magazine design for your creative career, you'll gain practical techniques and creative insights to elevate your layout skills. Learn how to structure content, manage assets with Adobe Bridge, automate captions, and export your final layout for print, all while deepening your understanding of visual hierarchy and design flow.

You’ll also explore advanced layout features like Gridify and Live Captions, refine your use of Object Styles, and gain workflow tips for consistent, professional results. With downloadable assets and guided practice, this course empowers you to follow along, experiment confidently, and produce a polished magazine layout ready for print or portfolio presentation.

By the end of the course, you’ll have completed a full magazine layout and developed the confidence to apply these techniques to any editorial project. No prior design experience required.

title: Revit & Civil 3D for Landscape BIM Workflow
description:
This course provides a comprehensive BIM workflow for landscape architecture using Revit and Civil 3D, guiding learners through every stage of a landscape project. It begins with essential Revit fundamentals—covering parameters, families, templates, and project organization—then moves into structured project setup including coordinate systems, worksets, and sheet management.

A significant portion of the course focuses on modeling landscape elements. You'll learn to create hardscape features such as floors, curbs, seat walls, retaining walls, ramps, stairs & guardrails. Civil 3D integration is covered for grading surfaces and aligning topography within Revit. Planting design is addressed through both component-based and area-based methods using Toposolid, along with scheduling strategies for planting and site components.

You’ll also develop skills in creating and distributing custom families for site furniture, signage, parking elements, and lighting. Coordination tools such as interference checks are included, along with visibility management techniques like view templates, filters, annotations, legends, and site sections. Revision workflows and export options to CAD, PDF, and Navisworks support final documentation.

Each chapter includes quizzes to reinforce learning, and the course concludes with a final exam to validate your mastery. By the end, you’ll be equipped to manage landscape BIM projects with clarity, precision, and confidence across all phases of design and documentation.

title: Complete workflow for CG and VFX inside Blender Batman scene
description:
What does this package contain?

- Step-by-step tutorial in which we create the animation you can see in the introduction video, plus all resources and .blend file we work on in the tutorial.

- Simple City generator - Since we are also creating a "Simple city generator" in the tutorial, it is included in the package.

In this tutorial, we create a Batman animation inspired by the vibe from the movie The Batman (2022) by taking a small part from the movie to have the best possible reference for lighting and color-grading, and we built the entire scene around that, about 90% of the scene will be CGI at the end.

So, this is partly a VFX tutorial because we will try to blend live footage with CG elements.

This approach allows us to achieve the best result faster and more efficiently.

This is actually similar to how most of the scenes in the film were shot. The city in the film is mostly CG.

Although I could have imported ready-made buildings there because I am the creator of "Editing building asset pack" and have created many of them in the past, I decided from the beginning to create an asset package just for this tutorial and scene to record the whole process and learn as much as possible.

This time, the asset package was powered with the Geometry nodes modifier, and the result is a fully procedural city that we manage with a few sliders.

This part of the tutorial is ideal if you want to go deeper into Geometry nodes, modeling, and texturing.

SIMPLE CITY GENERATOR (INCLUDED)

City Generator is a simple but functional Geo Neode setup that is designed for quickly creating a city in the background.

With just 11 sliders, you can control and change the look of the entire city - from the density of small buildings, large buildings, seeds, and rotation seeds to the lighting inside the buildings and even the lighting of the entire city.

title: Build Your Own Single-Cycle RISC-V CPU from Scratch

visible_instructors.title: Jeevanandh R
visible_instructors.name: Jeevanandh
visible_instructors.job_title: VLSI & Embedded Systems Developer | RTL Designer | Educator

description:
Ever wondered how a CPU works at the signal level — not just conceptually, but truly inside?
This course is your step-by-step guide to building your own Single-Cycle RISC-V processor from scratch, using Verilog and industry-style RTL design methods.

We’ll start from the fundamentals — understanding the RISC-V ISA, instruction formats, and architecture flow — and gradually move toward creating a complete working CPU core capable of executing instructions, handling memory, and performing control operations.

By the end of this course, you’ll not only have a fully functional single-cycle RISC-V CPU, but also a deep understanding of processor internals — knowledge that directly translates into real-world RTL design and verification roles.

What You’ll Learn

  • Design and implement a Single-Cycle RISC-V processor in Verilog

  • Understand the RISC-V instruction formats and dataflow architecture

  • Create and integrate key modules — ALU, Control Unit, Register File, Memory, and more

  • Write testbenches to simulate and verify your CPU’s functionality

  • Gain industry-level exposure to RTL design flow and debugging techniques

Tools & Environment

  • Verilog (any simulator: ModelSim, Vivado, or online tools like EDA Playground)

  • RISC-V ISA reference

  • A text editor and logic-level curiosity

Who Is This Course For

title: Hybrid Electronics Enclosure Design with Thermal Simulations

visible_instructors.title: Arwa Habib
visible_instructors.name: Arwa
visible_instructors.job_title: PHD Scholar/ Clinical Psychologist/ Lecturer/ Researcher

description:
Take your SolidWorks skills to the next level with a complete, hands-on project — designing a hybrid electronics enclosure that combines 3D-printed plastic components with aluminum heat sinks for superior cooling and performance.

In this course, you’ll learn every step of the design process, from the first sketch to final assembly and thermal simulation. You’ll model every detail in SolidWorks, understand how to combine plastic and metal parts effectively, and use thermal simulation tools to make design decisions backed by data.

The project centers on creating a functional, high-efficiency enclosure for electronic components. The top and bottom aluminum heat sinks handle heat dissipation, while a custom 3D-printed plastic body provides structure, alignment, and housing for all internal parts. You’ll also integrate cooling fans as per simulation results to achieve optimal airflow and thermal balance.

Whether you’re a student, engineer, or product designer, this course will strengthen your understanding of SolidWorks modeling, assembly creation, and simulation techniques while introducing real-world design practices used in the electronics industry.

What you’ll learn:

  • Complete workflow of SolidWorks modeling and assembly design

  • Designing hybrid enclosures using aluminum and plastic materials

  • Creating parametric 3D models and complex geometry

  • Top to down modeling and assembling techniques

  • Setting up thermal simulations and analyzing heat transfer

  • Designing and positioning fans based on simulation data

  • Generating manufacturing drawings and preparing models for FDM 3D printing

  • Understanding real-world thermal management in electronic enclosures

Why take this course:
This isn’t just another SolidWorks tutorial — it’s a professional-level project that demonstrates how to design with both functionality and manufacturability in mind. You’ll gain the confidence to work on real engineering problems, build a portfolio-ready project, and learn the workflow engineers use to bring thermal-efficient enclosures to life.

Join now and start designing hybrid electronics enclosures that are not only innovative and aesthetic but also optimized for real-world performance.

title: Mid-Century Illustration: Create Retro-Inspired Artwork
description:
As artists, we all know how easy it is to get stuck chasing the perfect outcome. All the overthinking & criticizing of our own work can get frustrating, even scary sometimes. But honestly, there’s so much fun in just letting go and drawing freely — loose, full of life and character. And that’s exactly what we’re going to do in this class, all while exploring one of the most charming mid-century illustration styles — where wonky lines and quirky shapes make everything come alive.

In this class I’ll walk you through five different exercises. You’ll learn to loosen up, let go of perfection, and boldly draw quirky motifs in mid-century style. You’ll get to know the main characteristics of mid-century illustration and, step by step, discover how to create without fear – but with joy, confidence, and courage. You’ll be surprised how freeing it feels once you start!

You can follow along with markers and pen on paper, or on your iPad in Procreate, using the resources I’ve created for you.

And here’s the best part: in this class, you have full permission to make mistakes and to welcome the happy accidents – because being imperfect is perfect.

So, are you ready? Then let’s dive in and have some fun together!

title: Stencil Magic-I, Creating a Tool for Design Application.

visible_instructors.title: Ritu Sangal
visible_instructors.name: Ritu
visible_instructors.job_title: Dr. Ritu Sangal, Professional Artist and Art Craft Educator

description:
Creating a Tool for Design Application

Handcrafted Stencil-Making for Artists, Educators & Explorers

Unleash your creativity and craft your own artistic tools through the accessible and empowering practice of stencil-making—no drawing skills required!

This course is designed for curious beginners, creative professionals, and art educators who want to explore new ways of expressing their ideas. You’ll be guided step-by-step through the process of transforming any image or concept into a stencil-ready design. Learn how to simplify visual elements, understand positive and negative space, and confidently cut your design using just a few simple tools.

Unlike store-bought stencils, handmade ones reflect your own artistic identity. They allow you to create bold, personal patterns and repeatable motifs that can be used across a wide range of media:- painting, printmaking, mixed media, journaling, wall art, or textile design.

Best of all? You don’t need fancy tools or professional skills. The beauty of this practice lies in its simplicity. Choose a material that’s easy to cut but sturdy enough to reuse, such as paper, acetate, tracing sheets, or recycled plastic folders. Add a pencil, pen, eraser, cutting board, and a stencil knife as no fancy materials or professional setup is required. If you can trace, you can stencil! You’ll be ready to make art that’s bold, repeatable, and truly your own.

Say goodbye to store-bought designs and hello to the freedom of handcrafted expression. Whether you're working on a canvas, a journal, a wall, or fabric, your stencil becomes a tool for design, storytelling, and experimentation.

By the end of this course, you’ll not only have created a set of your own stencils, but you’ll also have discovered a powerful, repeatable tool to enrich your creative process and amplify your unique voice.

Let’s move beyond templates and into a space where your imagination leads—one cut at a time.

Welcome - you’re in the right place.


The Character Drawing Masterclass is a complete drawing course that starts at zero. Along the way, we’ll use character drawing as the foundation - because learning to draw characters also teaches you the fundamentals of drawing in general: gesture, line quality, form, perspective, shading, and design.


This course is designed to feel like your personal art school. You’ll learn how to:

By the end of this course, you won’t just know how to draw characters - you’ll know how to draw, period. You’ll have the skills to create original characters, practice different art styles, and tell stories through your drawings.


No matter your level - whether you’re an absolute beginner or someone who’s tried drawing before but felt stuck - you are welcome here. I’ll guide you step by step, with structured lessons, practice sessions, and projects designed to help you see real progress.
